definition: to smoke/to fumigate/to assail the nostrils/to perfume
fragrance/warm/to educate/variant of 熏[xun1]/to smoke/to fumigate
to smoke/to fumigate/to assail the nostrils/to perfume
fragrance/warm/to educate/variant of 熏[xun1]/to smoke/to fumigate
to smoke/to cure over a fire
smoke and baking fire (idiom); surrounded by flames and smoke
to exert a gradual influence/to nurture/a corrupting influence
obsessed by a craving for power/power-hungry

sentences.english: You'll never get the bacon grease off the plates if you don't use detergent.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不使用去垢剂你永远不能除去熏猪肉的油脂。

sentences.english: For appetizer my wife will have smoked salmon, but I preferashrimp cocktail.
sentences.chinese: 我太太要熏鲑鱼作开胃菜，但是我想要虾子。

sentences.english: Delicate smoked salmon provides a heart-healthy element to your table.
sentences.chinese: 精致的熏三文鱼为您的餐桌增加有益心脏健康的元素。

sentences.english: Purveyor of smoked Canadian trout, Alaskan salmon and Lake Superior whitefish .
sentences.chinese: 接受者加拿大熏鳟鱼，阿拉斯加鲑鱼和湖优越的白鱼。

sentences.english: Secondly, the process for producing liquid smoking Channel Catfish block was studied.
sentences.chinese: 其次对液熏斑点叉尾鲴加工工艺进行研究。

sentences.english: Fumigating wind brings us another spring, and also makes the ground green.
sentences.chinese: 熏风捎来又一个春天，也熏绿了大地。

sentences.english: The smell of four day-old dead pig caused me to faint.
sentences.chinese: 那猪死了四天了，异味把我熏晕了过去。

sentences.english: External use: use accordingly for washing with decoction or make into powder and use as paste.
sentences.chinese: 外用适量，常用来煎汤熏洗，或研末调敷。

sentences.english: A fireman collapsed from the fumes.
sentences.chinese: 一个救火员被浓烟熏倒了。

sentences.english: North Carolina smokes the whole hog in a vinegar-based sauce.
sentences.chinese: 北卡罗莱纳熏整只猪浇着含醋的酱汁。

sentences.english: I kept tame goats, and then kill and eat, and smoked and pickled.
sentences.chinese: 我饲养温驯的山羊，然后杀了吃，又熏又腌的。

sentences.english: All right, I'll take it instead.
Small smart snakes smelt smoked steaks.
sentences.chinese: 聪明的小蛇闻出了熏牛排的味道。

sentences.english: We used smoked whitefish, well boned, but any other smoked fish should work.
sentences.chinese: 我们采用熏白鱼，粘结好，但任何其他熏鱼应工作。

sentences.english: He cooked us all a big breakfast of bacon and fried eggs.
sentences.chinese: 他为我们每人做了一份有熏咸肉和煎蛋的丰盛早餐。

sentences.english: They fired the badger out of the hole.
sentences.chinese: 他们用火把獾从洞中熏出来。

definition: to smoke/to cure over a wood fire
smoke and baking fire (idiom); surrounded by flames and smoke
to burn/to cook/to stew/to bake/to roast/to heat/to boil (tea, water etc)/fever/to run a temperature/(coll.) to let things go to one's head
to choke (because of swallowing the wrong way)
to irritate the nose/to choke (of smoke, smell etc)/pungent/(coll.) (Tw) to shout at sb/to scold/to speak out against sb
fragrant/sweet smelling/aromatic/savory or appetizing/(to eat) with relish/(of sleep) sound/perfume or spice/joss or incense stick/CL:根[gen1]
